Key Match Events: Tommy Pham belted a three-run home run against Cleveland starter Ben Lively in the fourth inning.
Seth Lugo limited the Guardians lineup to a run on six hits in seven brilliant innings for his 15th win.
Paul DeJong and Robbie Grossman opened the fourth inning with base hits before Michael Massey drove in a run with an RBI single.
Eli Morgan replaced Ben Lively in the fifth inning after 78 pitches.
Lucas Erceg pitched a scoreless ninth for his ninth save.
Erick Sabrowski made his Major League debut with two outs in the seventh inning, striking out pinch-hitter Yuli Gurriel.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt said Lively battled the Royals lineup for the first three innings, despite not having the best command of his breaking pitches.
Vogt said Lugo hammered the bottom of the strike zone with his fastball all night.
Vogt was impressed with Sabrowski’s outing, given how long he waited to finally take the mound.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The loss snapped a three-game winning streak for Cleveland.
The Royals avoided a sweep and snapped a seven-game winless skid.
Cleveland’s bullpen covered four scoreless frames, marking its 51st game with at least three scoreless relief innings, a major league high this season.
In 13 games against KC this season, José Ramírez hit .308 (16-for-52) with six doubles, three home runs and a .953 OPS.
